Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix with part of stem; interior: red-figure decoration consisting of naked male figure to right (chest, arms, genitals, and thigh remaining), his hands inside a large basin (louterion) on a pedestal; exterior black with two narrow reserved bands around stem; inscription on interior.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 511, no. C78)
CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 48, pl. XXVII, no. 8)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1499)
